Job Title: Operations Supervisor

Location: Houston, TX

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Manufacturing, Supply Chain

Description:
Working at Freudenberg: "We will wow your world!" This is our promise. As a global technology group, we not only make the world cleaner, healthier and more comfortable, but also offer our 51,000 employees a networked and diverse environment where everyone can thrive individually. Be surprised and experience your own wow moments.

Freudenberg Sealing Technologies is a longstanding technology expert and market leader for sophisticated and novel applications in sealing technology and electric mobility solutions worldwide. Thanks to our unique materials and technology expertise, we are a proven supplier for demanding products and applications, as well as a development and service partner to customers in the automotive industries and in general industries. With our approximately 13,500 employees worldwide, we generate sales of about 2.5 billion euros.

Some of your Benefits 

401K Match: Save for retirement with the company's help.

Health Insurance: Rely on comprehensive services whenever you need it.

Vacation: We offer time off to refresh and recharge.

Paid Holidays: With paid-time off, local holidays are all the way more relaxing.

Safe Environment: We strive to ensure safety remains a top priority, and provide a stable environment for our employees.

 Houston, TX

On-Site

 Tobul Accumulator Incorporated

You support our team as

 Operations Supervisor 

Responsibilities 

Work with Lean Manufacturing Specialist / Lean Manufacturing Manager and use LEAN improvement methods to insure the most efficient layout of work cells through easy moving/standing operations and optimization of cell procedures and product flow.Supports the regional and global strategy implementation when it comes to manufacturing, product portfolio, and technological development.Investigates and review all quality information from various sources; coordinate and disseminate this information to appropriate personnel, through documentation and visual controls, to achieve scrap reduction and variance elimination.Directs, trains, and coordinates area personnel in the most effective and efficient procedures for problem-solving and task completion to manufacture a world-class quality product.Implement with the support of Lean Manufacturing Specialist / Lean Manufacturing Manager “Lean Philosophies” including One-piece flow, setting, and monitoring Standard Work in Process, dedicating labor and equipment, production smoothing, and 5S principles.Works closely with functional areas such as Manufacturing, Quality, Engineering, Supply Chain Management, and Sales to meet goals, resolve issues, and maintain customer satisfaction.Promotes cross-functional communication at all levels through implementing and maintaining an effective LPMS.Counsel and discipline associates in cases of deviations from work and safety standards. Observe and evaluate associates and identify underperformers as well as exceptional performers and provide feedback to associates, Facility Manager and Human Resources.Champion LEAN Programs and employee involvement in Kaizen events. Adheres to ISO 9001 and ISO 14001 and Quality guidelines.

Qualifications 

Four-year degree or equivalent related field/manufacturing experience. Proven track record in industrial business of delivering results for at least 5+ years in progressive responsible positions.Multi-year experience in leading complex CNC production operationAbility to read and interpret blueprints.Basic knowledge of CNC operation and capabilities.Project management, budgeting, and resource allocation skills.Excellent networking skills.Manage inventory of machine tools and parts.Review blueprints and inspect parts to ensure product quality and correctness.Machinery troubleshooting and basic project management.Reverse engineer parts and convert part dimensions to metal dimensions.Communication & Collaboration: Communicates clearly and concisely, while serving as a sparring partner to internal/external stakeholders. Fosters teamwork between employees and across the organization.Value for Customers: Drives a customer-oriented business strategy and provides indispensable support to deliver successful outcomes.Innovation: Envisions the impact of potential future trends and proactively drives necessary changes. Encourages creativity and initiative from employees.Drive & Execution: Inspires and motivates self and others, while taking full accountability for actions and results.#discoverfreudenberg

The Freudenberg Group is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and inclusion. Employment opportunities are available to all applicants and associates without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions), gender identity or expression, national origin, ancestry, age, mental or physical disability, genetic information, marital status, familial status, sexual orientation, protected military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
